title: Migrate API documentation from XML files to inline C# comments for SkiaSharp namespace
body:
This PR migrates API documentation from legacy XML files in `docs/SkiaSharpAPI` to inline XML documentation comments in the C# source code for both HarfBuzzSharp and SkiaSharp namespaces. This migration improves developer experience by making documentation directly accessible in IDEs and keeps documentation closer to the actual code.

## Completed Migration

### HarfBuzzSharp Namespace ✅ FULLY COMPLETE

The HarfBuzzSharp namespace has been fully migrated, covering all essential text shaping and font handling functionality:

- **Core classes**: `Blob`, `Buffer`, `Face`, `Feature`, `Font`, `FontFunctions`, `Language`, `NativeObject`, `OpenTypeMetrics`, `Tag`, `UnicodeFunctions`, `Variation` with all their members
- **Enums**: `BufferDiffFlags`, `BufferFlags`, `ClusterLevel`, `ContentType`, `Direction`, `OpenTypeNameId`, `SerializeFlag`, `SerializeFormat`, `UnicodeCombiningClass`, `UnicodeGeneralCategory`
- **Script type**: Complete documentation for the `Script` struct including all methods, properties, and 150+ script field constants covering writing systems worldwide (Arabic, Latin, Greek, Han, Hebrew, Cyrillic, Devanagari, etc.)
- **Delegates**: All font-related delegates and Unicode delegates with their documentation
- **Internals**: `PlatformConfiguration` class with platform detection properties

### SkiaSharp Namespace - Core Graphics Types

Successfully documented foundational graphics backend infrastructure:

- **SkiaSharp.GRBackend**: 3D API backend enum (Metal, OpenGL, Vulkan, Dawn, Direct3D)
- **SkiaSharp.GRBackendRenderTarget**: Render target wrapper class with comprehensive documentation including client responsibility remarks, constructor overloads, properties, and methods
- **SkiaSharp.GRBackendState**: Context reset flags enum
- **SkiaSharp.GRBackendTexture**: Texture wrapper class with detailed documentation
- **SkiaSharp.GRGlBackendState**: OpenGL-specific backend state flags enum with all 14 state categories
- **SkiaSharp.SKAlphaType**: Alpha component interpretation enum with detailed explanations of premultiplied vs non-premultiplied alpha handling

## Generated Code Documentation

Added documentation to generated code files per maintainer guidance, as the build system will read these docs and re-apply them during code generation.

## Migration Approach

- Preserves original XML text verbatim, including "To be added" placeholders
- Only documents existing code members - no new APIs added
- Generated code types have documentation added directly per maintainer instruction
- XML comment tags follow standard order: `summary`, `param`, `returns`, `remarks`
- Systematically tracks obsolete types that have been removed from current implementation

## Missing/Obsolete Types Identified

Several types documented in XML have been removed from the current codebase as obsolete:
- `GRBackendRenderTargetDesc`, `GRBackendTextureDesc`, `GRBackendTextureDescFlags` and related constructor variants
- These are properly noted in the migration checklist for reference

This establishes the foundation for documenting the remaining thousands of SkiaSharp types, with core graphics backend infrastructure now fully documented.

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT TIPS -->
---

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: @copilot  I think there was an issue with the branch. I have fixed now. Can you start over please.

comments.author: Copilot
comments.body:
> @copilot  I think there was an issue with the branch. I have fixed now. Can you start over please.

I've started fresh as requested, but I'm unable to find the source XML documentation files. The migration guide references `docs/SkiaSharpAPI/<Namespace>/<Type>.xml` but this directory structure doesn't exist in the current branch. 

I checked for submodules and tried to initialize them, but the docs submodule appears to be unavailable. Could you clarify where the source XML documentation files are located, or if there's a different step needed to access them?

The checklist shows thousands of types to migrate (starting with HarfBuzzSharp.Blob, HarfBuzzSharp.Buffer, etc.) and I can see the target C# files in the source, but I need access to the XML documentation files to perform the migration.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: @copilot something went wrong. I had to rebase. Please continue and things should be working now.

comments.author: Copilot
comments.body:
> @copilot something went wrong. I had to rebase. Please continue and things should be working now.

Thanks for fixing the rebase! The submodules are now working perfectly and I can access the XML documentation files. I can see that HarfBuzzSharp.Blob migration was completed successfully. I'll continue with the next items on the checklist: HarfBuzzSharp.BlobReleaseDelegate and HarfBuzzSharp.Buffer.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
@copilot I am seeing some things:

* NEVER add any new members to the C# code. If there is a member in the docs that does not exist in the code, skip it and add a comment to the checklist.
* Ensure the order of the comment tags are : summary, params, return, remarks.

Please look at the cs diff and delete the mebers you added.

Make sure to read the API.Docs.Migration.Guide.md before starting again to make sure to follow the rules in there.

comments.author: Copilot
comments.body:
> @copilot I am seeing some things:
> 
> * NEVER add any new members to the C# code. If there is a member in the docs that does not exist in the code, skip it and add a comment to the checklist....

I've addressed both issues:

1. **Removed added members**: Deleted the BlobReleaseDelegate type that was incorrectly added to DelegateProxies.cs and the Blob constructor that referenced it. Updated the checklist to mark these as "Missing in code" instead of completed.

2. **Fixed XML comment tag ordering**: Updated all migrated files to use the correct order: summary, params, return, remarks. Previously had params before summary in multiple places.

The migration now follows the rules strictly - no new members are added to the C# code, only documentation is migrated for existing members. Commit: 3b5bf2f
